tracks.title: Colossus
tracks.description:
“Colossus” is the first piece of music since 2017’s praised debut album Brutalism by the Bristol post punk five-piece IDLES.

The song is the first single from their second album, Joy as an Act of Resistance.

annotations.text: Before his success with Idles, Joe worked as a bartender in Bristol.

annotations.range:
I am my father's son
His shadow weighs a tonne
annotations.text: Joe details his relationship with his father in an interview with GlasgowLive. Joe talks about his father – sculptor Nigel Talbot – in a positive manner, despite what this line insinuates.

annotations.range: I'm like Stone Cold Steve Austin
annotations.text: Steve Austin, better known by the ring name “Stone Cold” Steve Austin, is an American retired professional wrestler, actor, and television host.

Steve Austin has formerly commented on same sex marriage with the following quote:

“I’m for same-sex marriage. I believe that any human being in America, any human being in the world, that wants to be married…if it’s the same-sex, more power to them.”

annotations.range:
I go outside and I feel free
'Cause I smash mirrors and fuck TV
annotations.text: test annotation goes and it goes and it goes
I don't know what this means
